description.narrative: The Arms Trade Treaty Monitor will contribute to a reduction in human suffering and armed violence by ensuring effective monitoring and transparency of implementation of the Arms Trade Treaty (ATT). The Monitor will serve as the only international monitoring mechanism for the Treaty, which serves to regulate the conventional arms trade across the world. The Monitor will provide timely information and analysis on universalisation of the ATT norms both through legal adherence and changes in the practice of non-state parties; ATT implementation, including the establishment of national legal and control systems and the application of the ATT criteria to arms transfers; and key challenges that need to be addressed at each stage of the universalisation and implementation process. The total value of this investment is $300,000 million over 3 years, starting 2017-18.
